Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.oob

Class OobModule

java.lang.Object
com.gemalto.idp.mobile.oob.OobModule
public class OobModule extends Object
OobModule class which is the entry-point for OOB features.
Since:
4.0

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static OobModule create()
      Create OobModule object.
      Returns:
      Oob Module.
      Since:
      4.0

    • createOobManager

      public OobManager createOobManager(URL oobUrl, String domain, String applicationId, byte[] rsaExponent, byte[] rsaModulus)
      Create OobManager object.
      Parameters:
      oobUrl - the URL of the OOB server.
      domain - the domain to use for requests to the OOB server. It must be compliant with server configuration on back-end side.
      applicationId - the application identifier to use for requests to the OOB server.
      rsaExponent - the RSA public exponent to use to communicate with the OOB server.
      rsaModulus - the RSA modules to use to communicate with the OOB server.
      Returns:
      OobManager.
      Since:
      4.0

    • createOobManager

      public OobManager createOobManager(URL oobUrl, String domain, String applicationId, RSAPublicKey publicKey)
      Create OobManager object.
      Parameters:
      oobUrl - the URL of the OOB server.
      domain - the domain to use for requests to the OOB server. It must be compliant with server configuration on back-end side.
      applicationId - the application identifier to use for requests to the OOB server.
      publicKey - The RSA public key to communicate with OOB server.
      Returns:
      OobManager.
      Since:
      4.0

    • reset

      @Deprecated public boolean reset(String applicationId)
      Deprecated.
      Cleanup the data associated with Oob module. All registered client will be removed for the given applicationId.
      Parameters:
      applicationId - the applicationId.
      Returns:
      true if reset is successful.
      Since:
      4.9.0
      See Also:
      • IdpCore.reset()
      • IdpCore.resetSDK(ResetModule)

    • getClientIDs

      public Set<String> getClientIDs(String applicationId) throws OobException
      Retrieve the Set of clientIds for given application ID
      Parameters:
      applicationId - The application ID.
      Returns:
      set of client IDs
      Throws:
      OobException - When the SDK is not able to retrieve the clientIDs. It can be caused by Database IO exception, passwordManager not logged in, or invalid DeviceFingerprint.
      Since:
      4.9.4
